kevin Micks  Staff writerMay  

Four candidates seeking to fill the chief of police position of the University Police Department are being interviewed by the university PERIOD



Interviews of the candidates began Tuesday and will continue through Monday when the search committee concludes interviews with the current acting Chief Adam Due PERIOD

The last candidate will be interviewed Monday and I am asking for the evaluations by Wednesday she said PERIOD Then we will start to score each of the candidates. to apply for the position candidates must have earned a bachelors degree in administration of justice political science criminal justice or law enforcement PERIOD

Each candidate is required to have served at a fulltime college or university in the past according to the position description from the Eastern Web site PERIOD

James Luecking current chief of police for the Champaign Police Department was the first candidate to be interviewed PERIOD

Luecking began his career in  as a patrol officer detective and juvenile officer for the city of Champaign PERIOD Since then he has been promoted four times up to his current position as Chief of Police PERIOD

The second candidate Randy Ervin interviewed Wednesday PERIOD Ervin began working as a military police officer in the United States Army in  PERIOD He spent  years working at the Coles County Sheriffs Department before becoming the Public Safety Captain at Lake Land College according to his resume PERIOD

After beginning his career as a police officer at the Illinois Institute of Technology

The third candidate Dexter Yarbrough will interview Friday PERIOD

Yarbrough worked as a narcotics investigator and executive protection specialist before landing his current position as chief of police at University of Wisconsins Parkside Police department PERIOD

Acting Chief of Police Adam Due will interview on Monday PERIOD

Due worked for two years as a deputy patrolman for Kane County Sheriffs Department PERIOD Due came to Eastern in  where he began as a patrol officer and has since been promoted six times to his current position PERIOD

The interviews start at  a.m PERIOD Throughout the day the interviewees tour the campus to meet with faculty students interim President Lou Hencken and UPD officers before concluding at  p.m PERIOD

Each of the interviews allot a 50minute openinterview session where students are encouraged to come and interview the candidates PERIOD

The students openinterview session will be from  to  a.m PERIOD for both candidates in the Paris Room of the Martin Luther King Jr PERIOD University Union PERIOD
